definition: vigorously/energetically/enthusiastically

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
stalwart/sturdy/strong/powerful
strength/energy/enthusiasm/spirit/mood/expression/interest/CL:把[ba3]/Taiwan pr. [jing4]

sentences.english: The mallards seemed like the colder it was the better in the pond.
sentences.chinese: 池中野鸭是愈冷愈游得起劲儿。

sentences.english: They talked of their holiday plans with great animation.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常起劲地谈着度假计划。

sentences.english: They are working hard to produce a program-controlled computer.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在起劲打造一台程序节制计算机。

sentences.english: When I finished sulkins, I double my efforts and worked even harder.
sentences.chinese: 我生完气，就加倍努力，于是更起劲。

sentences.english: Eg: Inspired by her example, the League members worked even harder.
sentences.chinese: 在她榜样的鼓舞下，共青团员们干得更起劲了。

sentences.english: HuiZhen turned to care for her husband.
Emil had already begun work and was mowing vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 爱弥儿已经在那里开始割草了，他干得十分起劲。

sentences.english: The more they worked, the more energetical they became.
As they were inspired by her example, the League members worked even harder.
sentences.chinese: 在她的榜样的鼓舞下，共青团员们干得更起劲了。

sentences.english: They were talking and laughing away but they stopped as soon as a visitor appeared.
sentences.chinese: 她们正说笑得起劲，见来了客人，便立即哑口了。

sentences.english: Gret efforts ensure the success of our work.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的起劲确保了我们工作的成功。

sentences.english: I wish I had a glass of beer; but I can't get up the gumption to go down to the village an' get it.
sentences.chinese: 天呐，我真想喝一杯啤酒，可又鼓不起劲下村子里去。

sentences.english: Clustered on the concrete, birds pecked at part of a candy bar stuck to
sentences.chinese: 在水泥地上，一群鸟儿起劲地啄着红纸包裹的糖果。
“海鲢鱼，”他很起劲地回答道，“很好吃。”

sentences.english: The others agreed and they all began to dig hard in the sand.
sentences.chinese: 别的孩于同意了，他们就都起劲地挖起沙来。

sentences.english: I didn't hear you calling me because i was in the zone with my study.
sentences.chinese: 我没有听见你给我打电话，我刚才学得正起劲呢。

definition: (dialect) to be full of zeal/high-spirited/exhilarating/to stir sb up
lively/full of vigor/vibrant/spirited
energetic/exciting/of interest
lit. isn't that a joy? (quote from Confucius)/fig. (jocularly) extremely/awfully
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
to be fascinated/to be enchanted
keen interest/concentrated attention
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
orderly/tidy/smooth
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
